TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SharedPropertyGroup extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of shared properties. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The shared property group is synchronized by the containing manager.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SharedPropertyGroupManager> class to create a SharedPropertyGroup.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_SharedProperties#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_12_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_SharedProperties#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_12_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_SharedProperties#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_12_1.vb)]

.method public hidebysig instance class System.EnterpriseServices.SharedProperty CreateProperty(string name, bool fExists) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the new property.
Determines whether the property exists. Set to on return if the property exists.
Docs.summary: Creates a property with the given name.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the `CreateProperty` method to create a shared property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.EnterpriseServices.SharedProperty Property(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the property with the given name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unlike <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.SharedPropertyGroup.CreateProperty%2A>, this property must already exist.
